results.title: Super Flight
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Beyond 2000”.
A Beyond 2000 special which looks at the latest advances in aeronautics, from ultra-lights to gyrocopters, from fighters to paraplanes, in fact every way in which man can currently take to the air.

results.title: Eternal Youth
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Beyond 2000”.
Everybody wants it, and many have searched for it. “Beyond 2000” explores the growth of the life prolonging industry and the study of gerontology. It’s a penetrating look at a topic dear to each and everyone of us - life!

results.title: Essay writing made easy
results.creator_credit: Peter Lane, Dennis Famigia, Ruth Lee and Deakin University
results.brief_description: James Valentine takes the viewer through the six stages of essay writing: analysing the question; researching; planning; writing; and editing & presentation. Each stage is clearly presented with practical advice from both academics and students. Study guide included.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Lane, Dennis Famigia, Ruth Lee and Deakin University

results.title: Espolio
results.creator_credit: Sidney Goldsmith, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film based on a poem by Earle Birney and a painting by El Greco. The theme concerns the responsibility of the innovator for the thing he makes. In the film, a carpenter builds a cross but is reluctant to become involved in the right or wrong of situations that bring men to die on crosses. His interest is in his own craftsmanship. To illustrate this moral, the filmmaker used light-pen drawings, giving color and emphasis through optical processes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sidney Goldsmith, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Espana Viva [kit]
results.brief_description: A kit for the “Espana viva” Spanish course for beginners consisting of two audio-cassettes divided into 15 units that correspond to the dialogues in the student text together with pronunciation practice and exercises. Included is a copy of the student text and teacher’s notes.

results.title: Eskimo summer
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, Michael McKennirey, Quentin Brown, Richard Robinson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “People of the Seal”.
Eskimo Summer is compiled from some of the most vivid footage ever filmed of the life of the Netsilik Inuit in the Pelly Bay region of the Canadian Arctic. Together, the two films provide insight and understanding of a culture now almost vanished, as they show the incredible resourcefulness of the Netsilik (People of the Seal) who have adapted to one of the world’s harshest environments. Part 1: Eskimo Summer shows how Inuit families prepare for winter by hunting seal, birds and caribou and by fishing for Arctic Char during the exentded hours of daylight. (Award: Salerno)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Young, Michael McKennirey, Quentin Brown, Richard Robinson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Eskimo artist: Kenojouac
results.creator_credit: John Feeney, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Beautiful Inuit prints by an artist who is also a wife and mother. This film shows how the Inuit artist’s drawings are transferred to stone and then printed for sale in the south.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Feeney, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Eskimo winter
results.creator_credit: Brian Branston, George Pearson, Michael McKennirey, Richard Robinson, British Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People of the Seal”.
The second of two co-productions by the British Broadcasting Corporation and the National Film Board of Canada, People of the Seal, Part 2: Eskimo Winter is compiled from some of the most vivid footage ever filmed of the life of the Netsilik Inuit in the Pelly Bay region of the Canadian Arctic. Together, the two films provide insight and understanding of a culture now almost vanished, as they show the incredible resourcefulness of the Netsilik (People of the Seal) who have adapted to one of the world’s harshest environments. Part 2: Eskimo Winter shows how Inuit families gather in communities on the sea ice to harpoon seal as they come up through breathing holes in the ice. Also seen is the mid-winter season, a time of intense socialising in the communal igloo, with games, contests and ceremonial activities. (Awards: Salerno; Trento) Narrated by Alexander Scourby
